title: Running FastKoko: Error generating speech
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**Screenshots or console output**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. When doing so., please ensure you have the first command that triggered the trace and/or the command that started up your build included, otherwise it is difficult to diagnose. 

**Branch / Deployment used**
Let us know if it's the master branch, or the stable branch indicated in the readme, as well as if you're running it locally, in the cloud, via the docker compose (cpu or gpu), or direct docker run commands. Please include the exact commands used to run in the latter cases.

**Operating System**
Include the platform, version numbers of your docker, etc. Whether its GPU (Nvidia or other) or CPU, Mac, Linux, Windows, etc. 

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.
Running FastKoko (gpu): Error generating speech: MediaSource.addSourceBuffer: Type not supported in MediaSource

Main branch.

Linux, Mint.

Latest Docker on Linux Mint 22
author: noorbeast

comments.body: I've heard this is an issue with FIrefox and can be resolved for some people by switching to Chrome based (though not always), but have a patch shortly which should be more compatible with any browser

> I've heard this is an issue with FIrefox and can be resolved for some people by switching to Chrome based (though not always), but have a patch shortly which should be more compatible with any browser

Installed Brave and indeed it does seem to be a browser related issue, though yesterday Fast Kokoro was working fine on LibreWolf, I am looking forward to a patch for a long term resolution.

title: Failed to run in docker wsl
body:
Trying to run it on docker on wsl and I keep getting this error:
``` bash
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     | ERROR:    Traceback (most recent call last):
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 693, in lifespan
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     async with self.lifespan_context(app) as maybe_state:
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/usr/lib/python3.10/contextlib.py", line 199, in __aenter__
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     return await anext(self.gen)
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/fastapi/routing.py", line 133, in merged_lifespan
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     async with original_context(app) as maybe_original_state:
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/usr/lib/python3.10/contextlib.py", line 199, in __aenter__
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     return await anext(self.gen)
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/dist-packages/fastapi/routing.py", line 133, in merged_lifespan
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     async with original_context(app) as maybe_original_state:
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/usr/lib/python3.10/contextlib.py", line 199, in __aenter__
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     return await anext(self.gen)
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/app/api/src/main.py", line 52, in lifespan
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     voicepack_count = await TTSModel.setup()
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/app/api/src/services/tts_base.py", line 46, in setup
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     os.makedirs(cls.VOICES_DIR, exist_ok=True)
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |   File "/usr/lib/python3.10/os.py", line 225, in makedirs
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |     mkdir(name, mode)
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     | PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/app/api/src/voices'
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     |
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1     | ERROR:    Application startup failed. Exiting.
kokoro-fastapi-kokoro-tts-1 exited with code 3
```

The model-fetcher and gradio-ui containers seem to be running fine but the kokoro-tts container crashes as soon as it starts.
Also in gradio, I just see a message saying "TTS service: Waiting for service..."
author: ronneldavis

comments.body:
had the same issue on arch.
reconnected ssh, restarted tmux = resolved. 
it was probably permissions at some level, even though i was root.
